info.title: Baas Banking
info.description:
**Description**: Api responsible for managing accounts, statements & balance # Schemas ## Account statuses
Status Description
`BLOCKED` Informs that the account is blocked and can not do any transaction.
`ENABLED` Informs that the account is enabled and ready for use.
`CANCELED` Informs that the account is canceled and not able to do anything.
# Status Change Notification Some statuses changes will fire a notification call to the client. To receive this notifications, its necessary to request the registration of the service URL which will receive the notification object. This object will be sent as a HTTP call with the POST method, of which the client must respond with a 200 status and within 5 seconds. | Event Type | Description | |---------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | `account_block-balance-created` | Block balance was created | | `account_block-balance-cancelled` | Block balance was cancelled and the blocked value returned to user the account | | `account_block-balance-unblocked` | Block balance was unblocked and the blocked value returned to user the account | | `account_block-balance-captured` | Block balance was captured from another credit event | For block balance request more details use the route `GET /accounts/{account_id}/blocks/{block_id}` ### Notification Call Scheme #### *Header* ```json { X-R4-Application: GUID, // Application Unique Identifier X-R4-Delivery: GUID, // Attempt Unique Identifier X-R4-Event: {event_type}, // Event Type for the Notification (as described in Event Type table) User-Agent: R4-Hookshot } ``` #### *Body* ``` { "object_kind": "{event_type}", // Event Type for the Notification (as described in Event Type table) "object_id": "GUID", // Payment Unique Identifier "account_id": "GUID" // Account Unique Identifier "application_id": "GUID" // Application Unique Identifier } ``` # Errors Account Middleware uses [HTTP response status codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_status_codes) to indicate the success or failure of your API requests. In general, there are three status code ranges you can expect: - `2xx` success status codes confirm that your request worked as expected - `4xx` error status codes indicate an error because of the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was not provided) - `5xx` error status codes are rare and indicate an error with R4's servers ## HTTP Status code summary Extracted from [Stripe API codes](https://stripe.com/docs/api/errors) - `200 - OK` Everything worked as expected. - `400 - Bad Request` The request was unacceptable, often due to missing a required parameter. - `401 - Unauthorized` No valid API key provided. - `403 - Forbidden` The API key doesn't have permissions to perform the request. - `404 - Not Found` The requested resource doesn't exist. - `408 - Request Timeout` The connection was ended by timeout. - `429 - Too Many Requests` Too many requests hit the API too quickly. We recommend an exponential backoff of your requests. - `500, 502, 503, 504 - Server Errors` Something went wrong on R4's end. ## Error codes Below is a list of possible error codes that can be returned:
Code Description
`ACCOUNT_NOT_FOUND` The account informed was not found.
`BLOCK_BALANCE_NOT_FOUND` The block balance informed was not found.
`PERSON_NOT_ACTIVE` The profile person is not active.
`PROFILE_NOT_FOUND` The profile informed was not found.
`UUID_INVALID` The uuid informed was not valid.
`REQUEST_VALIDATOR_ERROR` The request is not formatted correctly.
`UNAUTHORIZED` The request unauthorized, no valid API key provided

get.description: Returns a list of accounts. If no account is found, an **empty** list will be returned.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Base64 filter to bring only accounts after the provided value

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Base64 filter to bring only accounts before the provided value

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The numbers of accounts to return. Can be omitted if provided before or after filters with limit embedded in them. If nothing is provided, the default will be 1000 as limit

parameters.name: document_number
parameters.description: The CPF document number for a specific account.

after.description: cursor pointing at the last item of the list. If no more items exist, the property is removed from the response

before.description: cursor pointing at the first item of the list. If its the first available item, the property is removed from the response

application_id.description: Unique identifier of the application which the account is bound.

status.description: Status of the account. [See definitions here](#account_statuses).

name.description: Name of the person bound to the account.

document.description: Document of the person bound to the account.

  - `CPF`: Pessoa física (Natural)
  - `CNPJ`: Pessoa jurídica (Juridical)
